body: Happy to help with a bugfix or docs update if appropriate. :)
I think that warning comes from nfpm, likely something is not being properly handled in this integration, good catch, thanks!

things we'll need to do:
- refactor nfpm.validate to be pure (no side effects)
- refactor nfpm.validate to also validate packager specific configs (call packager.validate) 
- set the deprecation noticer in a sync.once, probably

issue.title: feat: added a ReportDeprecations method

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

repository.name: nfpm
repository.description: nFPM is Not FPM - a simple deb, rpm, apk, ipk, and arch linux packager written in Go

issue.body:
added these methods as way to report deprecations without doing the entire validation thing.  

refs https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/issues/3067

body: oh, its worse actually... we only create a `nfpm.Info` later on, and can't really do it cleanly earlier... it might be easier to just re-do the validations again on goreleaser...

issue.title: fix: nfpm deprecation on nfpm check

body: This issue has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
